decks.notes: This deck focuses on creating infinite combos with cards like Saheeli Rai and Felidar Guardian, allowing you to generate unlimited tokens or infinite damage. The deck also includes cards like Teferi, Time Raveler to protect your combos and disrupt your opponent's strategy. By efficiently ramping with cards like Wrenn and Six and Omnath, Locus of Creation, you can quickly assemble your combo pieces and overwhelm your opponent. This deck aims to outmaneuver and outpace your opponent through strategic card interactions and powerful combo potential.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing a combination of powerful control spells and versatile creatures such as Uro and Omnath. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Cryptic Command and Force of Negation while also generating value with cards like Wrenn and Six. The deck also incorporates ramp with Growth Spiral and Hour of Promise to quickly establish a strong mana base. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor adds additional control and card advantage to the deck.

The deck heavily focuses on controlling the game through counter spells and removal, while also ramping up mana with cards like Uro and Omnath. It utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace and Teferi to disrupt the opponent's strategy and generate card advantage. The deck aims to win by out-valuing the opponent with powerful threats like Wrenn and Six and Field of the Dead, while maintaining control of the board with cards like Cryptic Command and Supreme Verdict. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to all colors for maximum flexibility in spells.

This deck focuses on assembling the Heliod Spike Combo, where Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Spike Feeder work together to gain infinite life and create infinite +1/+1 counters on a creature. The deck includes cards like Conclave Mentor and Auriok Champion to support the combo and protect against disruption. Collected Company and Ranger-Captain of Eos help search for key pieces, while Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf ramp up mana for faster combo execution. This deck aims to quickly create an unbeatable board state through infinite life gain and creature growth.

The main concept of this UW Control deck is to maintain control of the game by utilizing a combination of powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, along with countermagic spells such as Cryptic Command and Force of Negation. The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with removal spells like Path to Exile and Supreme Verdict, while generating card advantage through cards like Wall of Omens and Archmage's Charm. The deck also aims to control the tempo of the game by utilizing cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Mystic Sanctuary for additional value.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using Human creatures. By consistently playing creatures like Champion of the Parish, Thalia's Lieutenant, and Mantis Rider, the deck aims to quickly build a strong board presence and pressure the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Reflector Mage helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Aether Vial and Noble Hierarch provide additional utility and mana acceleration. The mana base of the deck is optimized to support the diverse casting costs of the Human creatures.

This deck aims to quickly ramp up mana using rituals and rituals like Manamorphose to cast powerful spells such as Goblin Charbelcher and Irencrag Feat. The key strategy is to use cards like Reforge the Soul and Recross the Paths to refill the hand and find necessary combo pieces. Chalice of the Void and Blood Moon help disrupt opponent's game plan while Valakut Awakening and Bala Ged Recovery provide card advantage. The deck forgoes traditional lands in favor of non-traditional mana sources like Simian Spirit Guide and Tangled Florahedron.

The deck focuses on using counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also utilizes land ramp and value engines like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Omnath, Locus of Creation to generate card advantage and stabilize the board. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind them out in the late game, while also having the flexibility to control the tempo of the match with counterspells and removal.

The main concept of this Ad Nauseam combo deck is to use cards like Ad Nauseam, Angel's Grace, and Phyrexian Unlife to draw the entire deck as quickly as possible, finding and casting Thassa's Oracle to win the game instantly. The deck utilizes various mana ramp spells like Lotus Bloom and Pentad Prism to generate enough mana to go off, while also including cards like Pact of Negation and Spoils of the Vault to protect the combo and ensure a smooth execution. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces and win the game before the opponent can disrupt the plan.

This deck focuses on deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures quickly while disrupting the opponent's strategy with Chalice of the Void and Karn, the Great Creator. The deck also includes versatile removal options like Dismember and Warping Wail to deal with threats. Expedition Map helps to assemble the Urza Tron lands for mana acceleration, allowing for big plays early in the game. The inclusion of cards like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer ensures that the deck remains aggressive and proactive, putting pressure on the opponent from the start.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the Allosaurus Combo, using cards like Eldritch Evolution and Neoform to cheat creatures into play. The key strategy is to ramp into big creatures like Allosaurus Rider and Chancellor of the Tangle, then use cards like Nourishing Shoal and Noxious Revival to gain life and go off with Laboratory Maniac or Griselbrand for the win. The deck also has ways to protect itself with Veil of Summer and can dig for combo pieces with cards like Serum Visions and Turntimber Symbiosis.

This deck aims to ramp up mana quickly to cast Primeval Titan and utilize lands to generate additional value, such as Field of the Dead for token generation and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle for direct damage. The use of Amulet of Vigor allows for explosive plays with bounce lands, while Karn, the Great Creator provides utility and access to a sideboard toolbox. The deck is focused on efficiently assembling its combo pieces to overwhelm opponents with massive creatures and strategic land usage.

The deck focuses on aggressively building up a board presence with human creatures that benefit from each other's presence and synergize well with cards like Aether Vial to quickly deploy creatures at instant speed. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using cards like Meddling Mage and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben while also putting pressure on the opponent with evasive creatures like Mantis Rider. The deck's mana base is optimized to consistently cast its creatures efficiently and effectively.

This deck focuses on efficiently disrupting the opponent's hand and board while applying pressure through powerful creatures. By using cards like Liliana of the Veil, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan, the deck aims to control the board and maintain card advantage. Meanwhile, cards like Tarmogoyf, Bloodbraid Elf, and Scourge of the Skyclaves provide a fast clock to close out the game before the opponent can recover. The deck also features removal spells like Fatal Push, Lightning Bolt, and Assassin's Trophy to deal with threats and clear the way for its own creatures.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using red spells and creatures with low mana costs. The inclusion of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion enhances the damage output of odd-cost spells and creatures. Cards like Bonecrusher Giant, Monastery Swiftspear, and Lightning Bolt allow for consistent damage to be dealt each turn. Magus of the Moon disrupts opponent's mana base, while Seasoned Pyromancer and Light Up the Stage provide card advantage to keep up the pressure.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to stall the opponent's threats, disrupt their game plan, and ultimately win the game through powerful late-game threats like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck utilizes a variety of powerful lands to provide flexibility and ensure strong mana fixing. It aims to outvalue the opponent, grind them out of resources, and ultimately establish board control to secure victory.
